Package message

Class MessageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • message.MessageManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class MessageManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The MessageManager class is responsible for handling message-related actions. allUserMessages is a map of usernames to all of their Message objects.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createNewMessage

        private Message createNewMessage​(java.lang.String message,
                                 java.lang.String senderUsername,
                                 java.lang.String recipientUsername)
        Creates a new Message object.
        Parameters:
        message - Refers to the content of the new message.
        senderUsername - Refers to the String username of the user sending the message.
        recipientUsername - Refers to the String username of the user receiving the message.
        Returns:
        Return the created message.

      • addMessage

        public void addMessage​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.String recipientUsername)
        Adds a new message to the list of all messages a user has (their "inbox").
        Parameters:
        username - Refers to the username of the sender.
        message - Refers to the message to be added.
        recipientUsername - Refers to the username of the recipient.

      • addMessage

        public void addMessage​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.String recipientUsername,
                       boolean beenRead,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime dateTimeCreated,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime dateTimeDeleted,
                       boolean starred,
                       boolean deleted,
                       boolean archived,
                       java.time.LocalDateTime dateTimeCreatedCopy)
        Adds a read in message to the list of all messages a user has
        Parameters:
        username - username of the sender
        message - content of the message
        recipientUsername - username of the recipient
        beenRead - whether or not this message has been read
        dateTimeCreated - The date and time this message was created and sent
        dateTimeDeleted - The date and time this message was deleted (if it has been deleted)
        starred - Whether or not this message has been starred
        deleted - Whether or not this message has been deleted
        archived - Whether or not this message has been archived
        dateTimeCreatedCopy - Refers to the date and time the message was created and sent.

      • viewMessages

        public java.util.List<Message> viewMessages​(java.lang.String username)
        This method allows the user to see all of their messages.
        Parameters:
        username - Refers to the username of the user.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of messages relating to the user.

      • checkIsMessageable

        public boolean checkIsMessageable​(java.lang.String to,
                                  java.lang.String from,
                                  UserManager userManager)
        Checks if the user sending the message should be able to contact the recipient.
        Parameters:
        to - Refers to the username of the recipient.
        from - Refers to the username of the sender.
        userManager - Refers to the UserManager object used to correlate usernames with User objects.
        Returns:
        Return true if the sender should be able to message the recipient, and false otherwise.

        Refers to the map allUserMessages.

      • speakerBlastMessage

        public void speakerBlastMessage​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> eventNames,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                EventManager eventManager,
                                java.lang.String sender)
        This method sends a message to all of the attendees of the specified event.
        Parameters:
        eventNames - Refers to the list of events to which you want to send the attendees a message.
        message - Refers to the string content of the message.
        eventManager - Refers to the class handling all of the events.
        sender - Refers to the username of the sender.

      • generateEffectiveMessageList

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> generateEffectiveMessageList​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                                     java.lang.String inboxType)
        Returns a List of "messages", where messages are encoded as a List of strings.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the User who's messages you want to generate.
        inboxType - Refers to the type of inbox.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of the user's messages, where messages are of the form [sender, content, timestamp, read status, starred status, deletion status, archive status]
